wikipedia_page.main: Archibald Pinnell (1870–1948) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper.

response: Maxwell was born in Motherwell (though resided mainly in Hamilton in his youth)The Allan Maxwell Story, Tony Onslow, EFC Heritage Society, 14 April 2020 and played for Cambuslang in the inaugural season of the Scottish Football League, also featuring in the Glasgow FA v Sheffield FA challenge fixture, before joining English club Everton in 1891, along with goalkeeper Archibald Pinnell.

Robertson's earliest known club was Chatham of the Southern League. In 1898 he joined another Kent-based club, New Brompton, where he spent three seasons and made a total of 63 Southern League appearances. In his first eleven games he played as a defender, but he then took over from Archibald Pinnell as goalkeeper for two games before returning to his outfield role. After leaving New Brompton he had a short spell with Bristol City of The Football League and later played for Accrington Stanley.
